xxl.core.relational
Class JoinUtils

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.JoinUtils

public class JoinUtils
extends Object

This class contains various static methods for managing result set metadata, creating result tuples and composing predicates during join operations.

Most of these methods are used internally by the join operation of this package.

This class cannot become instantiated.

See Also:
NestedLoopsJoin

Method Detail

genericJoinTupleFactory

public static Function<Tuple,Tuple> genericJoinTupleFactory(Function<Object,? extends Tuple> tupleFactory,
                                                            MergedResultSetMetaData metadata)
Returns a function that builds up a result tuple after performing a join. To compute the resulting relation, this function has to be called for every list of tuples that qualify for the result.

Parameters:
tupleFactory - a function to create a tuple. The FACTORY_METHOD of ArrayTuple or ListTuple can be used.
metadata - the metadata information of the resulting relation.
Returns:
a function that builds up a result tuple after performing a join.

naturalJoinPredicate

public static Predicate<Tuple> naturalJoinPredicate(MergedResultSetMetaData metadata)
Returns a predicate that compares tuples of the joined relations. This predicate can be passed to the join routines of the cursor package. So far, this method is used only by methods declared in this class.

Parameters:
metadata - the metadata information of the resulting relation.
Returns:
a predicate that compares tuples of the joined relations.

naturalJoinMetaDataPredicate

public static MetaDataPredicate<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> naturalJoinMetaDataPredicate(ResultSetMetaData... metadata)
Returns a metadata predicate for a natural join.

Consequently, a predicate and the metadata is computed.

This factory method is used by the nested-loops join. There it is used to generate a new metadata predicate that provides the metadata for the join and decides whether a list of tuple join or not.

Parameters:
metadata - the metadata information of the resulting relation.
Returns:
a metadata predicate for a natural join.

thetaJoinMetaDataPredicate

public static MetaDataPredicate<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> thetaJoinMetaDataPredicate(Predicate<? super Tuple> theta,
                                                                                                   ResultSetMetaData... metadata)
Returns a metadata for a theta join.

Consequently, the metadata for the join (and the given predicate) is computed.

This factory method is used by the nested-loops join. There it is used to generate a new metadata predicate that provides the metadata for the join and decides whether a list of tuple join or not.

Parameters:
theta - the predicate that is used to decide whether a list of tuples join or not.
metadata - the metadata information of the resulting relation.
Returns:
a metadata predicate for a theta join.

semiJoinMetaDataPredicate

public static MetaDataPredicate<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> semiJoinMetaDataPredicate(MetaDataPredicate<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> joinMetaDataPredicate,
                                                                                                  ResultSetMetaData[] metadata,
                                                                                                  int... metadataIndices)
Returns a metadata for a semi join.

Consequently, a predicate and the metadata is computed.

This factory method is used by the nested-loops join. There it is used to generate a new metadata predicate that provides the metadata for the join and decides whether a list of tuple join or not.

Parameters:
joinMetaDataPredicate - the metadata predicate that is used to decide whether a list of tuples join or not and that provides the metadata for the semi join.
metadata - the metadata information of the resulting relation.
metadataIndices - the indices of the relations that are required for building the resulting relation of the semi join.
Returns:
a metadata predicate for a semi join.
